hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Preceding BEAR-to-NEUTRAL Transition
hypothesis_content.statement: During BEAR regimes, when 10-day realized volatility falls below 20-day realized volatility while price consolidates within a 5% range for 8+ days, a regime transition to NEUTRAL will occur within the next 3-5 trading days with an initial 4-8% directional move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BEAR regimes typically end not with a V-shaped reversal but with volatility compression and exhaustion of selling pressure. Neutral funding indicates lack of aggressive short positioning. This compression often resolves with a regime change as uncertainty decreases and the market seeks a new equilibrium.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day realized volatility < BTC 20-day realized volatility
BTC price range (high-low) < 5% over the last 8 trading days
Cumulative funding rates across major perpetual swaps are neutral to slightly negative (between -0.005% and 0.01%)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime model confirms shift to NEUTRAL (confidence > 60%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price breaks below the 8-day consolidation range low by >3%
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days after entry if no transition occurs

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volatility compression in a BEAR regime leads to continuation downward (breakdown) more than 60% of the time, rather than a transition to NEUTRAL.
